results.title: 8½
results.brief_description: Guido Anselmi, a film director, finds himself creatively barren at the peak of his career. Urged by his doctors to rest, Anselmi heads for a luxurious resort, but a sorry group gathers—his producer, staff, actors, wife, mistress, and relatives—each one begging him to get on with the show. In retreat from their dependency, he fantasizes about past women and dreams of his childhood.
results.description: Guido Anselmi, a film director, finds himself creatively barren at the peak of his career. In retreat from their dependency, he fantasizes about past women and dreams of his childhood.

In retreat from their dependency, he fantasizes about past women and dreams of his childhood.

results.title: 42nd Street
results.brief_description: A producer puts on what may be his last Broadway show, and at the last moment a chorus girl has to replace the star.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

results.description: A producer puts on what may be his last Broadway show, and at the last moment a chorus girl has to replace the star.
description_for_label: A producer puts on what may be his last Broadway show, and at the last moment a chorus girl has to replace the star.

results.title: 25th Hour
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, 40 Acres & A Mule Filmworks, Julia Chasman, Sandra Hernandez, Tobey Maguire, Jon Kilik, Spike Lee, James Chinlund and David Benioff
results.brief_description: In New York City in the days following the events of 9/11, Monty Brogan is a convicted drug dealer about to start a seven year prison sentence, and his final hours of freedom are devoted to preparing his girlfriend for his extended absence.

constellations_other.name: Post-9/11
constellations_other.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Touchstone Pictures, 40 Acres & A Mule Filmworks, Julia Chasman, Sandra Hernandez, Tobey Maguire, Jon Kilik, Spike Lee, James Chinlund and David Benioff
results.description: In New York City in the days following the events of 9/11, Monty Brogan is a convicted drug dealer about to start a seven-year prison sentence, and his final hours of freedom are devoted to hanging out with his closest buddies and trying to prepare his girlfriend for his extended absence.
description_for_label: In New York City in the days following the events of 9/11, Monty Brogan is a convicted drug dealer about to start a seven-year prison sentence, and his final hours of freedom are devoted to hanging out with his closest buddies and trying to prepare his girlfriend for his extended absence.

results.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
results.brief_description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Space, cinema and fakes
constellations_other.description: Before and after humans stepped foot on the moon, outer-space and the stars have inspired filmmakers, artists and game makers to imagine what's beyond our atmosphere.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
results.description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.
description_for_label: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

results.brief_description: A contemporary, ensemble drama telling the complex tale of six high school students whose lives are interwoven with situations that so many of today’s youth are faced with.
results.description: A contemporary, ensemble drama telling the complex tale of six high school students whose lives are interwoven with situations that so many of today’s youth are faced with. The story takes place during a normal school day. At precisely 2:37 a tragedy will occur, affecting the lives of a group of students and their teachers. As the story unfolds, the individual stories of the six teenagers are revealed, each with its own explosive significance. An unwanted pregnancy unravels a terrible, dark secret; all is not as it appears for the seemingly confident school football hero; an outcast must deal with everyday taunts from his peers; a beautiful young girl battles an eating disorder; a stellar student constantly struggles to win his parents’ approval; while another uses drugs to escape from his own demons.
description_for_label: A contemporary, ensemble drama telling the complex tale of six high school students whose lives are interwoven with situations that so many of today’s youth are faced with. The story takes place during a normal school day. At precisely 2:37 a tragedy will occur, affecting the lives of a group of students and their teachers. As the story unfolds, the individual stories of the six teenagers are revealed, each with its own explosive significance. An unwanted pregnancy unravels a terrible, dark secret; all is not as it appears for the seemingly confident school football hero; an outcast must deal with everyday taunts from his peers; a beautiful young girl battles an eating disorder; a stellar student constantly struggles to win his parents’ approval; while another uses drugs to escape from his own demons.

results.title: 13th
results.brief_description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

constellations_other.name: The world's end
constellations_other.description: For people of colour oppressed by systemic racism, genre stories about the end of the world and cosmological monsters can be used to re-examine race and the injustices faced in real life.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.
description_for_label: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

results.title: 11'09''01 - September 11
results.creator_credit: Galatée Films, CIH Shorts, Catherine Dussart Productions (CDP), Comme des Cinémas, Imamura Productions, La Générale de Production, Les Films 13, Les Films de la Plaine, MISR International Films, Makhmalbaf Film House Productions, Sequence 19 Productions, Sixteen Films, Studio Maj, StudioCanal, Zeta Film (MX), Sabrina Dhawan, Danis Tanović, Ken Loach, Nicolas Mauvernay, Paul Laverty, Jacques Perrin, Claude Lelouch, Alejandro González Iñárritu, Vladimir Vega, Sean Penn, Mira Nair, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shōhei Imamura, Samira Makhmalbaf, Idrissa Ouedraogo, Pierre Uytterhoeven, Marie-Jose Sanselme and Daisuke Tengan
results.headline_credit: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Burkina Faso, Egypt, France, India, Iran, Israel, Japan, Mexico, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
results.brief_description: 11 directors show their view on the terrorist attacks on the world trade center in New York.

constellations_other.name: Post-9/11
constellations_other.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Galatée Films, CIH Shorts, Catherine Dussart Productions (CDP), Comme des Cinémas, Imamura Productions, La Générale de Production, Les Films 13, Les Films de la Plaine, MISR International Films, Makhmalbaf Film House Productions, Sequence 19 Productions, Sixteen Films, Studio Maj, StudioCanal, Zeta Film (MX), Sabrina Dhawan, Danis Tanović, Ken Loach, Nicolas Mauvernay, Paul Laverty, Jacques Perrin, Claude Lelouch, Alejandro González Iñárritu, Vladimir Vega, Sean Penn, Mira Nair, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shōhei Imamura, Samira Makhmalbaf, Idrissa Ouedraogo, Pierre Uytterhoeven, Marie-Jose Sanselme and Daisuke Tengan

results.title: [CENSORED]
results.creator_credit: Arenamedia, Chloé Brugalé and Sari Braithwaite
results.brief_description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [CENSORED] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.

constellations_other.name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
constellations_other.description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [CENSORED] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.
description_for_label: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [CENSORED] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.

results.title: "Shia Labeouf" Live

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: “Shia LaBeouf” is a comedic song by Rob Cantor about actor Shia LaBeouf. The song, which was released in 2012, depicts LaBeouf as an “actual cannibal” who kills other people for sport. - Wikipedia
description_for_label: “Shia LaBeouf” is a comedic song by Rob Cantor about actor Shia LaBeouf. The song, which was released in 2012, depicts LaBeouf as an “actual cannibal” who kills other people for sport. - Wikipedia

images.caption: Still from "Shia LaBeouf" LIVE, directed by Randall Maxwell

results.title: [Dr. Stuart Fraser Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
Dr Stuart Fraser (b.1898) was an amateur 16mm filmmaker. He studied medicine in Melbourne, graduating in 1923. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by his son, Graeme Fraser.

This film features children at play in Elwood, Victoria, in the 1930s.

In the film we a see a young toddler playing in a well-maintained suburban garden. The toddler can be seen playing with a variety of garden sprinklers, with and without water, and various toys.

A notable part sees a toddler riding a pony on the Elwood foreshore near Ormond Esplanade. The short glimpse we see of the houses in the background provides a fascinating, if very short, contrast to modern day Elwood.

Originally made using 16mm AGFA film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:56:00 toddler holding a metal cigarette case while watching a spinning sprinkler

00:01:13:00 man holding a toddler while they play with his reading glasses

00:01:58:00 dog jumping up trying to reach a teddy bear held by a child

00:02:09:00 lady holding string attached to a pram while rolling it down a driveway towards the camera

00:02:39:00 baby in yard with teddy bear

00:05:54:00 baby playing with a sprinkler

00:06:18:00 baby in a small tin bath

00:07:45:00 baby eating in highchair

00:08:24:00 baby playing with wooden clothes pegs

00:09:19:00 baby wearing man’s hat in backyard

00:10:03:00 baby playing with blocks, cards, and other toys on a rug in backyard

00:10:37:00 infant being held while wrapped in a blanket

00:11:01:00 toddler in backyard wearing a bag as a hat

00:11:35:00 a lady pushing a pram through botanical gardens, perhaps Royal Melbourne Botanic Gardens

00:12:25:00 baby in pram next to a pond with ducks

00:15:53:00 toddler riding a pony on the Elwood foreshore

00:17:22:00 infant on changing table

00:17:51:00 infant in tin bath

00:18:31:00 young girl playing with toy pram

00:18:59:00 young girl pushing a toy pram containing a teddy bear
